thread.title: A glimpse inside BA business-only flight with Google
thread.title_full: A glimpse inside BA business-only flight with Google

title: A glimpse inside BA business-only flight with Google
text:
A glimpse inside BA business-only flight with Google Last updated 10:08, September 30 2015 Google Street View 
Online users can now take a virtual tour of BA's A318 business class cabins. 
Travellers can now enjoy a virtual seat on a British Airways, business-only flight to New York, by using a new Google Maps street view of the plane cabin. 
Those wanting to experience the business-only flight can do so from their couch. Google Maps gives 360 degree views of the airport, before virtually walking you to the plane across the London City Airport tarmac. 
Once inside the A318 Club World London City, 32-seater business jet, you are free to take a look around. 
Potential passengers can also take a virtual stroll into the private lounge provided for British Airways business class customers. Duty free and check-in areas can also be explored. 
British Airways are hoping the virtual tour will spark interest for potential customers, who will be able to view the inside of the flight before they book. 
The tour also offers information for users who want to discover more parts of the airport, like details of concessions and directions. 
The images were shot by panoramic photographer Hugh Flough, who spent three days using a special DSLR camera. 
The images were then formatted and stitched together to create a vibrant virtual experience. 
British Airways' Club World London City service was launched in September 2009 and offers two flights daily,
